item.title: [IN-356] Investigate why some icons are not in the correct place
item.description:
4. Mistake on some icon placements.
Nabire in (Baird AJTMH 1997) is not located in west Papua next to Bawe.

Some icons appear in the sea.
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9692162 should be North Sulwasi.
Are these errors in my coordinates or transcription?
I check the map I generated loads of times.
item.summary: Investigate why some icons are not in the correct place

item.title: [IN-355] split studies in different pins
item.description:
3. One icon can represent several studies.
Which misses important data.
Is it not possible to do each study site separately?
eg Timika yellow icons has three studies.

Can you shift the pin slightly so they density of studies can be seen or is that too hard?
item.summary: split studies in different pins

item.title: [IN-354] investigate missing journals and replace all authors with first author
item.description:
2. Some Journals are missing from the trial data.
see Papua - Ratcliffe TRSTMH ?2007
It is really important people can track where the studies come from and important data is missing.
You need First author (not all authors), Title, Journal and Year (plus vol/issue etc if possible).
The link helps you jump to the Pubmed citation which is nice.
But would be good to have more of the reference in the bubble.
item.summary: investigate missing journals and replace all authors with first author

item.title: [IN-353] Set a new Category CQS as chloroquine sensitive
item.description:
What about happened Chloroquine Sensitive??
CQS is chloroquine sensitive not Uncategorised.
If you have early Primaquine and no failures I code that as uncategorised since Pq could be masking.

These categories are really only suitable for CQ studies (see the CQR sheet on the extracted data).
Other ACT studies should be simply represented uncategorised
item.summary: Set a new Category CQS as chloroquine sensitive

item.title: [IN-352] update vivax lengend according to ric
item.description:
1. Can you spread the legend out wider at the bottom of the map?
It would allow 2 lines for some cetagories rather than 3.
Also why not start at left with most severe icons in red (>10% at day28), and then progressing lighter shades of red/orange for the less hard evidence.
End with Case Reports Green, and finally Uncategorised Blue.
item.summary: update vivax lengend according to ric

item.title: [IN-184] Update Aq surveyor according to Celine feedback
item.description:
1) Virtual tour
-We would like to remove the step 'Navigating the surveyor' because it is a repetition of the 'Overview' and 'Filtering data' steps...
-In the step 'Filtering data by time': could you please change the term 'performed' by 'published' because the date is the publication date, not the date of the samples collection
-Should we add a step 'Country report' to the virtual tour? Such as 'For countries with more than 3 reports, a report can be generated here...'

2)Other remarks/suggestions:
-We would like that the table that appears below the map when clicking on a pin should only refer to the report the user have clicked on. But we would like to add something to be able to display the pins for a whole country by clicking somewhere else.I know the Country report does that already but could we find another simple way of doing this besides the country report.
-Besides changing the lat and long of the pins that are group together because of 'specific location unknown' (we are working on it), we would like to add something to the pins, or change the shape of these pins. Then , it could be added to the virtual tour information: 'When the specific location is known, the pins appear as...., when it is unknown, the pins are....'.
-Could you center the data in the column 'Samples' that appears in the tab after clicking on one pin.
-We have removed from the database the medicines listed below because they are not antimalarials. We deleted them from the table 'drugs' and 'api'. I don't know if this will change anything for you but just in case. (please check they don't appear in the medicines filter anymore)
item.summary: Update Aq surveyor according to Celine feedback

item.title: [IN-73] [0.1] Review Salmonella genus/specie changes
item.description:
Suggest that the Salmonella should be listed as:

Old fashioned clinical biologist
Salmonella serovar typhi

Salmonella species
Salmonella Typhi
Salmonella Cholerasuis
Salmonella Paratyphi A
Salmonella Paratyphi B
Salmonella Typhimurium
Salmonella Enteritidis
Salmonella  Group A
Salmonella  Group B
Salmonella  Group C
Salmonella  Group D
Salmonella  Group E

All of these, expect the first, are in the species Salmonella enterica. Hence the full name for bacterium of typhoid is Salmonella enterica serovar Typhi. There may be some others, John and Hugh, in Africa that I have not included ?
item.summary: [0.1] Review Salmonella genus/specie changes

item.title: [IN-28] Install alfresco community
item.summary: Install alfresco community

comments.comment: Of course it takes much more time to complete. After successfull installation of Alfresco Community 5 I spent a few days integrating it with CAS. It learnt me a lot, but I still have problems with /share app asking to login twice. It is important, since in version 5 /share is the only user interface - /alfresco no longer provides user interface. So I installed version 3.4, which we are using in production. It should be more convenient, since we won't change user interface and probably any data structures. It is all fine, but takes a time.

It took about 2 weeks. The problem is not in installing Alfresco itself, but integration with CAS, especially Alfresco's SHARE application, which is second front end connecting Alfresco's web scripts (and there is problem - in connections from Alfresco to Alfresco ).

This is test installation on my PC, but it is easily repeatable on any server, where we find enough disk space.
